content: Hotel Transylvania is a monster themed hotel chain founded by Count Dracula in 1897 as a safe, welcoming place for creatures traveling among humans. Today, all locations keep that same promise: comfort, privacy, and a little nocturnal charm.

Standard check in requires a government issued photo ID or an equivalent monster credential, plus a valid payment method for incidentals. If you are checking in under a different name, the primary guest must add you to the reservation before arrival.

Cancellation is free with at least 24 hours notice prior to your scheduled check in time. Cancellations inside 24 hours may be charged one night room and tax, unless you have a nonrefundable promotional rate.

We accept all major credit and debit cards, including contactless payment. For traditional travelers, we also accept verified gold coins and appraised ancient treasures, which are valued at check in and documented on your folio.

A refundable incidental hold is placed at check in to cover extras like dining charges, spa services, or accidental claw marks. The hold amount depends on room type and length of stay, and it is released after checkout once the room is cleared.

Our pet policy is friendly to unusual companions, including dragons, griffins, and three headed dogs, as long as they are supervised in public areas. Fire breathing pets must be registered at check in so we can provide a spark safe room setup.

If your pet breathes fire, we provide heat resistant bedding, a stone water bowl, and a fire safety walkthrough. For everyone’s comfort, open flame tricks are not allowed in hallways, elevators, or near drapes.
All locations offer complimentary WiFi in guestrooms and common areas. If you need higher bandwidth for streaming, gaming, or coven meetings, ask the front desk about premium speed upgrades.
Every hotel has a heated or cooled pool depending on the season, plus a gym and spa. Pool temperature can be adjusted for cold blooded guests on request, within safe limits.
Housekeeping is available daily unless you request privacy. Services include coffin turndown, web dusting for spider guests, and fresh towel restocking for mummies who prefer extra wraps.
Coffin cleaning is offered as a standard amenity for Coffin Suites and any room with a coffin bed setup. If you bring your own coffin, we can provide lining refresh and polish as an add on service.

Dining is designed for monster diets, with blood type room service options, a clearly labeled garlic free menu, and allergy notes for silver sensitivity. Midnight snacks are available nightly from 11:00 PM to 2:00 AM in the lobby lounge.

If you need blood type room service, you can choose from O, A, B, or AB options, plus a synthetic blend for ethical dining preferences. Orders are discreetly delivered in temperature controlled flasks.

All restaurants and room service can prepare meals without garlic on request, and garlic is never used as a garnish. If you have additional sensitivities, tell us at ordering so we can flag the kitchen.

Safety protocols include special fire precautions for dragon guests, including designated cooling zones and nonflammable hallway runners. Our staff are trained to handle minor scorch events calmly and quickly.

Rooms are silver free by default to protect werewolves and other silver sensitive guests. If you require silver for personal reasons, we can place you in a designated silver safe room that is separated from standard floors.

Kids under 12 stay free when sharing a room with an adult, using existing bedding. Teen guests can join our teen vampire programs, which include supervised night activities and optional daylight safety training.

If you are traveling with a teen vampire, we recommend registering their program schedule at check in so staff can coordinate curfew preferences. Programs are designed to be fun and safe, with quiet hours respected for other guests.

Quiet hours are observed nightly from 10:00 PM to 7:00 AM across all locations. Howling, thunderous stomping, and dramatic cape swooshing are welcome earlier, but please keep it gentle during quiet hours.

The Fang Club loyalty program lets you earn points on room stays, dining, and spa services. Tiers include Fresh Fang, Night Stalker, and Elder, with benefits like late checkout when available and complimentary midnight snacks at higher tiers.

Fang Club points typically post within 48 hours after checkout, and you can redeem points for free nights or upgrades when available. If points are missing, contact support with your confirmation number and checkout date.

Spa services vary by location but commonly include fang whitening, fur grooming, and wing massage. If you have delicate scales or brittle bones, tell the spa in advance so they can tailor the treatment.

Our business center is available for corporate monsters and includes printing, scanning, secure WiFi, and private meeting booths. If you need an after hours session, the front desk can provide access based on availability.

We host weddings and events with monster themed packages, including a Howling at the Moon ceremony option and custom menu planning. Event teams can coordinate lighting and sound for sensitive guests, like vampires and banshees.
For corporate or general help, call 1 800 DRACULA to reach our central support line. They can assist with reservations, Fang Club questions, and connecting you to any location’s front desk.
Hotel Transylvania San Francisco is located at 666 Vampire Avenue, San Francisco, CA 94102. The main phone number is (415) 555 FANG.
San Francisco check in is at 3:00 PM and check out is at 11:00 AM. If you arrive early, we can store bags and notify you as soon as your room is ready.
Valet parking is available for $40 per night in our underground garage. Oversized hearses and carriage style vehicles may require advance notice due to clearance limits.
San Francisco has 150 rooms, including Coffin Suites, Moonlight Penthouses, and Family Crypts. If you need extra bedding for bats or small goblins, request it before arrival to ensure availability.
Room pricing in San Francisco typically ranges from $200 to $500 per night, depending on season, room type, and view. Fog season weekends tend to book faster, especially for Golden Gate view rooms.
A signature feature in San Francisco is our fog proof windows with Golden Gate views. If you prefer a darker room for daytime sleeping, ask for blackout drapes at check in.
San Francisco weather is famously foggy, so we recommend bringing a cape or a warm layer even in summer. If you forget, the front desk can loan a travel cape based on availability.

We are about 30 minutes from San Francisco International Airport, also known as SFO, depending on traffic. If you want a private carriage transfer, our concierge can arrange pickup with advance notice.

Popular nearby attractions include the Golden Gate Bridge, Fisherman’s Wharf, and Alcatraz ghost tours. If you want help with tickets, ask concierge Elvira and she can recommend the best night time slots.
Every Friday from 9:00 PM to midnight, San Francisco hosts the Monster Ball in the main hall. Entry is included for registered guests, and dress code is polished, not gory.
If you are sensitive to noise, ask for a room away from the Friday Monster Ball area. Our team can place you on a quieter floor when available, especially for early sleepers and tiny skeletons.
The San Francisco on site manager is Frank N. Stein. For dining recommendations, reservations, or a scenic route to the Golden Gate, concierge Elvira is your best first contact.

Directions tip: if you are arriving from SFO by car, aim for downtown San Francisco and follow signs toward Civic Center, then proceed to 666 Vampire Avenue. If you are using rideshare, confirm the destination zip code 94102 to avoid wrong drop offs.

San Francisco Moonlight Penthouses are popular for proposals and private events, with premium views and extra space. If you want a specific view angle of the Golden Gate, note it in your reservation request.

If your dragon companion needs cooling after a long flight, San Francisco can provide a chilled stone rest pad and a water station. Please notify the front desk when you arrive so the setup is ready before your pet enters the room.

Fog proof windows are designed to stay clear, but if you notice any condensation, call the front desk and maintenance will recalibrate the seal. This service is free and usually takes less than 30 minutes.

Family Crypt rooms in San Francisco work well for parents traveling with kids under 12, since children stay free with existing bedding. If you need a crib, request it early because inventory is limited.

For a simple itinerary, try Golden Gate at sunset, Fisherman’s Wharf for late snacks, and Alcatraz ghost tours for a spooky history fix. Concierge Elvira can tailor this based on your mobility needs and daylight preferences.
Hotel Transylvania New York is located at 123 Ghoul Street, New York, NY 10001. The front desk phone number is (212) 555 BITE.
New York check in is at 4:00 PM and check out is at 12:00 PM to account for NYC traffic and turnover. If you need early check in, request it in advance and we will do our best based on occupancy.
Self parking in New York is $60 per night due to limited city space. If you are driving a large vehicle, call ahead so we can confirm garage fit and entry instructions.
New York has 200 rooms, including Standard Crypts, Broadway View rooms, and Times Square Penthouses. Broadway View rooms are best for guests who want skyline lights without the street level noise.
Typical nightly pricing in New York ranges from $250 to $600, with higher rates during holidays and peak weekends. If you are flexible on room type, ask about weekday deals for better value.
A key New York feature is soundproof walls designed for the city that never sleeps. If you are extremely noise sensitive, request an interior facing room for the calmest experience.
New York weather runs through four seasons with hot, humid summers and colder winters. Pack layers, and consider an umbrella cape if you are arriving during spring rain.
We are about 45 minutes from JFK Airport under normal traffic, though rush hour can extend that. If you are arriving late at night, our concierge can advise the fastest route option for your timing.

Nearby attractions include Times Square, Central Park for midnight runs, and the Empire State Building. If you want a vampire friendly schedule, we can help plan activities that avoid harsh midday sun.
Every Saturday at 10:00 PM, New York hosts Vampire Comedy Night in the lounge. Seating is first come first served for guests, and content is spooky but family safe.
If you are in town for Broadway, ask about Broadway View rooms and late night room service timing. Our kitchen can coordinate a post show meal delivery so you do not miss the midnight snack window.
The New York manager is Countess Carmilla, and the main entrance is staffed by doorman Igor. If you have accessibility needs, Igor can direct you to the step free entry and elevator access.

Directions tip: if you are arriving by rideshare, confirm 123 Ghoul Street, New York, NY 10001, and note that traffic may require a short walk from the drop off point. If you have heavy luggage, call the doorman and we will assist curbside.

Times Square Penthouses are our premium option in New York, offering extra space and bright skyline views. If you need darker sleeping conditions, we provide blackout setups upon request even in high view rooms.

If your three headed dog gets anxious in crowded elevators, we can advise the least busy travel times and offer a service corridor route when available. Please coordinate with the front desk so we can keep the experience calm for you and other guests.

For Fang Club members, late checkout requests in New York are prioritized by tier, but still depend on occupancy. If you need a guaranteed late departure, ask about booking an additional half day rate when available.

If you are planning a small event, New York can host private gatherings with sound controlled rooms to avoid disturbing neighbors. Event timing is best scheduled after 7:00 PM when the city energy matches the mood.

If you want an easy night plan, try Times Square lights at dusk, a midnight run in Central Park, then Vampire Comedy Night on Saturdays at 10:00 PM. Concierge support can also plan routes that avoid crowded sidewalks.
Hotel Transylvania Chicago is located at 789 Werewolf Way, Chicago, IL 60601. The front desk phone number is (312) 555 HOWL.
Chicago has the earliest check in time at 2:00 PM, with check out at 11:00 AM. If you arrive before 2:00 PM, we can store your luggage and message you when the room is ready.
Parking in Chicago is free for registered guests, which is a popular Midwest perk. If you are arriving with a trailer or oversized vehicle, call ahead so we can guide you to the best spots.
Chicago offers 120 rooms, including Lake View Coffins, Windy City Suites, and Winter Crypts. Winter Crypts are ideal if you like extra insulation and warmer bedding during cold months.
Typical pricing in Chicago ranges from $180 to $450 per night, making it our most affordable location. Weekends during summer festivals can increase rates, so booking early helps.
A Chicago specialty is our deep dish pizza delivery partnership, available late into the night. You can order to your room and request garlic free preparation if needed.
Chicago weather is known for cold winters and wind, so pack a warm coat or a thick cape. If the wind is intense, ask the desk for indoor route tips to nearby attractions.
We are about 35 minutes from O’Hare International Airport under normal traffic. If you are arriving during a snowstorm, travel time can increase, so consider padding your schedule.
Nearby attractions include Navy Pier, Willis Tower, and Millennium Park. If you want a quick photo stop, Millennium Park is great for groups and family crypt travelers.
Chicago hosts the Full Moon Howl a thon once a month, with the exact date announced at the start of each month. Guests can join in the main hall, and quieter seating is available for sensitive ears.

If you are a werewolf traveling during a full moon, let us know at check in so we can provide extra sound buffering and a calming kit. We can also suggest event participation options if you want to howl with the pack.
The Chicago manager is Lon Chaney Jr. For dining questions, our chef partner is Wolfgang Puck, in a werewolf themed collaboration that keeps the menu hearty and late night friendly.

Directions tip: if you are driving into downtown Chicago, set your GPS to 789 Werewolf Way, Chicago, IL 60601 and look for the wolf crest sign near the entrance. Free parking access is through the side gate after check in verification.
Lake View Coffins are popular in Chicago for guests who want water views without the high city price tag. If you want a higher floor for a quieter stay, request it during booking.
If you are visiting in winter, ask about Winter Crypt rooms which prioritize warmth and reduced draft. We can also provide extra blankets and hot beverage options that remain garlic free.

For late night food, Chicago’s deep dish delivery partnership can usually deliver to rooms between 6:00 PM and 1:00 AM. If you are arriving very late, call ahead and we will suggest the best available option.
If you need a quiet stay during the monthly Howl a thon, request a room away from the event spaces. Our staff can also offer ear friendly kits for guests who are sound sensitive.

For a simple Chicago itinerary, try Navy Pier in the evening, Willis Tower for skyline views, and Millennium Park for a relaxed stroll. The front desk can recommend the best times to avoid heavy crowds and winter wind.
